titleStmt.title: Andrew L. Robinson to Oliver P. Morton
CWG1107

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p: Enclosed I hand you copy of a record in a case of the State vs John W. Rutherford who has fled into Crittenden County State of Kentucky, with the request that you grant a requsition upon Governor Bramlette for the rendition of the fugitive to the end that he may be brought into this County for trial
I respectfully recommend R. A. Dowell Esq as a suitable person to act as your Agent to receive the fugitive from the authorities in Kentucky and to bring him into Indiana

You will please have the requsition sent direct
to Gov B. with the request that the warrant for the apprehension of Rutherford may be sent to me at this place and I will see that they are forwarded to the proper officer in Crittenden County

Very Respy & truly
A. L. Robinson
